com.accele.gage

Class ResourceLoaders

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.accele.gage.ResourceLoaders

  • public class ResourceLoaders
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class containing predefined instances of ResourceLoader.

    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    William Garland
    See Also:

      • TILE_MAP_LOADER

        public static final ResourceLoader<TileMapMeta> TILE_MAP_LOADER
        A loader that produces a TileMapMeta from a text file.

        A tile map file is essentially a properties file specifically used for generating tile maps. Information about the tile map is specified using key-value pairs in the format "key = value". Some properties are required in every map file, but others are optional. Each property must be declared on its own line.

        TileMap Attribute Information
        Key Description Value Required Example
        visibleTilesX Specifies how many tiles should be visible on the screen at any one time in the x-direction. By default, this value will be -1 (shows all tiles). An integer value No visibleTilesX = 16
        visibleTilesY Specifies how many tiles should be visible on the screen at any one time in the y-direction. By default, this value will be -1 (shows all tiles). An integer value No visibleTilesY = 16
        tileWidth Specifies how large the width of a tile should be. A floating-point value Yes tileWidth = 0.5
        tileHeight Specifies how large the height of a tile should be. A floating-point value Yes tileHeight = 0.5
        rowsize Specifies how many tiles makes up a row on the map. An integer value Yes rowsize = 10
        key Specifies the key to use for mapping between texture registry IDs and tile indices. The value can span multiple lines. An integer-string dictionary Yes key = { 0:"water_texture", 4:"fire_texture", 3:"grass_texture" }
        tiles Specifies the tile data for the tile map where the integer values correspond to the values specified in the key property. The value can span multiple lines. An integer array. Yes tiles = [0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 1, 0, 2, 5, 0, 0, 1, 1]

      • INTERNAL_FONT_LOADER

        public static final ResourceLoader<FontMeta> INTERNAL_FONT_LOADER
        A loader that produces a FontMeta from an internal font. This loader does not require a ResourceLocation and requires two additional arguments. The first argument must be an instance of the desired Font, and the second argument must be a boolean describing whether the font should be antialiased.
